title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a simple English-Spanish translator!

1. Create Dictionary<string, string> called 'translator'
2. Add translations: 'hello' → 'hola', 'goodbye' → 'adiós', 'friend' → 'amigo'
3. Look up and display the translation for 'hello'
4. Check if 'goodbye' exists, then display its translation
5. Add a new translation: 'water' → 'agua'
6. Use foreach to display all translations in format: 'English: Spanish'

hints.text: Create: Dictionary<string, string> dict = new Dictionary<string, string>(); Add: dict.Add(key, value); Access: dict[key]; Check: ContainsKey(key)
Duplicate keys: Adding the same key twice throws an error! Use ContainsKey to check first, or use dict[key] = value which updates if exists.
Accessing non-existent key: dict['xyz'] when 'xyz' doesn't exist = CRASH! Always use ContainsKey first!
Wrong foreach syntax: foreach (string x in dict) is wrong! Use foreach (var pair in dict) then access pair.Key and pair.Value.
Forgetting two types: Dictionary<string> is WRONG! Need TWO types: Dictionary<TKey, TValue> like Dictionary<string, int>.

commonMistakes.consequence: Adding the same key twice throws an error! Use ContainsKey to check first, or use dict[key] = value which updates if exists.
commonMistakes.correction: Review the correct syntax and best practices for this concept.
